skill.name: behaviors.skills.primitives.Filter
skill.description: For an agent to move toward a checkpoint and make its filtration capability running with a specified intensity. Once the checkpoint is reached, filtration starts. If the checkpoint is localized in a non accessible urban block, agent stays outside the urban block and activate the filtration anyway. Because filtering crowds with a checkpoint requires the presence of the agent, action can only be done on one chechpoint at a time.

parameter.name: intensity
parameter.description: The strenght that is used to filter crowds. The value is defined between 0 and 100. A value of '0' means "no filtration at all". A value of '100' means "totally blocked" (the crowds that interact with the checkpoint cannot go through it).

link.name: reach
link.description: To enact the decision to "reach" a resource node.

link.name: filter
link.description: To enact the decision to activate the filtration capability of the given checkpoint.

feedback.name: filtering
feedback.description: Sent once the agent makes the filtration running.
